programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: Roshan wants Bhide to help look for Sodhi after he disappears. Bhide takes Popatlal and Iyer to the party.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: Sodhi's wife threatens him to keep his promise to his son. Sodhi finds a way to keep it by lying to his wife.

programme.desc: Sodhi meets a doctor for an X-ray after getting a bad stomach ache and learns that there is something inside his body.

programme.desc: Jethalal is furious to learn that all the mangoes were rotten.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: Jethalal gets suspicious about Tapu's intentions. Tapu and his gang announce that they are going on a hunger strike for the cricket kit. Jethalal is sure only Champaklal can convince Tapu.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: A frantic Daya and Jethalal ask Champaklal to stop the kids from going on a hunger strike. They are shocked when Champaklal refuses to oblige and instead asks them to find a way on their own.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: Though the parents try different bribes, the children are still adamant about their hunger strike. However, everyone soon becomes worried when Tapu Sena faints.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: Tapu falling unconscious leaves everyone in the society on edge. Soon, things get chaotic when the media arrives to cover the strike.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: An accident with a BMW leaves Tapu Sena with more trouble than he bargained for. Soon, a bodyguard gets down from the car and starts following Tapu.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: The residents of Gokuldham society are thrilled when Bollywood superstar Salman Khan pays them a visit. Soon, they enjoy his presence and celebrate with a lot of singing and dancing.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: Salman Khan grants the society members' request by dancing with them. Sodhi takes Tapu and his friends to a cricket ground.

programme.desc: Jethalal and Daya decide to go to his friend's anniversary party at Surat. Taarak tells everyone Jethalal is not coming to the soda shop as he is out of town.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: Iyer informs Popatlal that there is indeed a water problem in Gokuldham. Popatlal tries to get Bhide to fix it.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: The residents find a piece of cloth clogging the water tank, and Champaklal volunteers to go into the tank and remove it.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: The residents worry the bag they found in the water tank may contain a bomb. However, they find the bag filled with demonetised banknotes.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: The residents suspect Jethalal to be the owner of the money, angering Champaklal. They vote to keep the bag of money in the society office.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: Inspector Chalu Pandey comes to Gokuldham to investigate the dirty money. Bhide tells Chalu Pandey that the money might belong to Jethalal.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: Bhide has a nightmare of being arrested. When Taarak cannot get in touch with Jethalal, he decides to go see him with Bhide and Iyer.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: The residents are shocked to see the Gadas still in Gokuldham as Bhide, Popatlal, and Iyer had assumed they left to escape arrest.

programme.title: Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah
programme.desc: Jethalal insists the bag of dirty money is not his. Later, Madhavi suggests giving the bag to the police, but Jethalal fears the police will suspect the residents.

programme.desc: The residents of Gokuldham breathe a huge sigh of relief when Champaklal returns home safe. They come together to celebrate the occasion.
